text: Somehow when I run the Turing sampler with `progress = true`  in VSCode, there's no progress bar any more. Does anyone encounter the same issue?

elements.text: Somehow when I run the Turing sampler with
progress = true
in VSCode, there's no progress bar any more. Does anyone encounter the same issue?

text: VScode has a new progress interface, you’ll notice it in the bottom status bar, if you click on it a notification with a bar will show up in the bottom right.

elements.text: VScode has a new progress interface, you’ll notice it in the bottom status bar, if you click on it a notification with a bar will show up in the bottom right.

text: For me it just shows "Julia: Evaluating..." and nothing else. Is there any settings that I should change...?

elements.text: For me it just shows "Julia: Evaluating..." and nothing else. Is there any settings that I should change...?

text: if you click on that it should show an actual bar in a notification. I don’t know much more other than VSCode has its own progress bars now. For what its worth I dont find it that great but…thats what microsoft shipped

text:
I would test out what this looks like-
```using ProgressLogging
@progress for i in 1:100
    sleep(0.5)
end```
to make sure the backends are working as expecte

elements.text: I would test out what this looks like-

    sleep(0.5)

text: That works as the progress bar shows up. However the Turing one is still not working

text: okay, I’m not sure how to fix that- of course it should just work. which version of abstractMCMC are you using `pkg> st AbstractMCMC`

elements.text: okay, I’m not sure how to fix that- of course it should just work. which version of abstractMCMC are you using

text: I'm using 1.0.1, the latest version. The issue is somehow still there

elements.text: I'm using 1.0.1, the latest version. The issue is somehow still there

text: Or, are there any ways to just print the progress bar out, as several versions before...?

elements.text: Or, are there any ways to just print the progress bar out, as several versions before...?

text:
yeah, I think you can force the use of TerminalLoggers -
```# before the sample call
using Logging
using TerminalLoggers: TerminalLogger
global_logger(TerminalLogger())```
(untested)

elements.text: yeah, I think you can force the use of TerminalLoggers -

# before the sample call
using Logging
using TerminalLoggers: TerminalLogger
global_logger(TerminalLogger())
(untested)

text: I also experienced not so great progress bars with visual studio code. It did show something, like 1.0% when sampling, but it never moves, until it is completed. So I have no idea how long something will take. Hence I switched back to the REPL where I have an ETA and everything

text: Now it suddenly does seem to work again for me in VSCode. It just nicely shows right now that my sampling is at 17.5%. In the beginning I tried all kinds of things and after 1 or 2 hours gave up and now it just randomly works lol
